content.1: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.
content.2: Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all
content.3: What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the sun?
content.5: The sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose.
content.6: The wind goeth toward the south, and turneth about unto the north; it whirleth about continually, and the wind returneth again according to his circuits.
content.7: All the rivers run into the sea; yet the sea
content.9: The thing that hath been, it
content.12: I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.
content.13: And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all
content.14: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and, behold, all
content.16: I communed with mine own heart, saying, Lo, I am come to great estate, and have gotten more wisdom than all
content.17: And I gave my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit.
